name: EOD Primary Tumor
title: EOD Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to code primary tumor in preference to a statement of FIGO stage.

**Note 2:** EOD Primary Tumor includes direct extension or discontinuous metastasis to the vagina (see codes 400 and 550).

**Note 3:** EOD Primary tumor excludes metastasis to adnexa or uterine serosa (See EOD Mets).
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(5) **Introduction to Female Reproductive Organs**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017 

(6) Erickson, B.A., Olawaiye, A.B., Mutch, D.G., et al. **Cervix Uteri**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive, preinvasive
Cancer in situ WITH endocervical gland involvement

Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) Grade III

Not clinically visible (diagnosed only by microscopy)
Measured stromal invasion less than or equal to  3.0 mm 

FIGO Stage IA1

Not clinically visible (diagnosed only by microscopy)

Measured stromal invasion 3.1 mm to 5.0 mm 

FIGO Stage IA2

Not clinically visible (diagnosed only by microscopy)
Measured stromal invasion less than or equal to 5.0 mm

FIGO Stage IA [NOS]

Confined to cervix AND 
Measured stromal invasion greater than 5.0 mm

FIGO Stage IB1, IB2, IB3

Localized, NOS
Confined to cervix uteri or uterus, NOS, except corpus uteri, NOS

FIGO Stage IB [NOS]

Corpus uteri, NOS 
Confined to corpus uteri, size, depth and horizontal spread unknown

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Any size tumor WITHOUT parametrial (paracervical soft tissue) invasion
- Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
- Upper two-thirds of vagina including fornices
- Vagina, NOS
- Vaginal wall, NOS

FIGO Stage IIA (IIA1, IIA2, IIA NOS)

Ligament(s) (broad, cardinal, uterosacral)
Parametrial (paracervical soft tissue) invasion

FIGO Stage IIB

Invasion beyond uterus, NOS

FIGO Stage II [NOS]

Bladder wall
Bladder, NOS excluding mucosa
Bullous edema of bladder mucosa
Rectal wall
Rectum, NOS excluding mucosa
Ureter, intra- and extramural
Vagina, lower third (not extending to pelvic wall)
Vulva

FIGO Stage IIIA

Described clinically as frozen pelvis
Hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney
Pelvic wall(s)

FIGO Stage IIIB

Fallopian tube(s)
Ovary(ies)
Urethra

FIGO Stage III [NOS]

Bladder mucosa (for bullous edema of bladder mucosa, see code 550)
Rectal mucosa
Sigmoid colon
Small intestine

FIGO Stage IVA

Further contiguous extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed 
Not documented in medical record

Death Certificate Only
